en: When therefore the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
hmr: Chun, Isûn Johan nêkin inchûktir tam lem a siem le a baptis ti Pharisaihaiin an hriet ti Lalpa chun a hriet phingleh,

en: (although Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples),
hmr: (nisienlakhawm, Isu meu chun a baptis nawh a, a închûktirhaiin an baptis lem hlak),

en: he left Judæa, and departed again into Galilee.
hmr: Judai ram chu a fe san a, Galili ramah a fe tah a.

en: And he must needs pass through Samaria.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari ram a fe thleng ding a na.

en: So he cometh to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph:
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari ram khaw pakhat, Sukar an ti chu a hung tlung a, Jakobin a nau Josef kuoma hmun a ipêk kâwl kha.

en: and Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
hmr: Jakob tuisunsuo khawm kha chutaka chun a um. Chuongchun, Isu chu a fe sâwl leiin tuisunsuo sîra chun a ṭhung chawt a; sûn bufâk pha a nih.

en: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.
hmr: Samari nuhmei pakhat tui chawi dingin a hung a, Isûn a kuomah, “Dâwn ding mi pe rawh,” a ta.

en: For his disciples were gone away into the city to buy food.
hmr: (A închûktirhai hlak chu fâk ding inchaw dingin khuoah an fe ta sih a.)

en: The Samaritan woman therefore saith unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, who am a Samaritan woman? (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Nang Juda mi i na, kei Samari nuhmei ka ni sih a, iengtizie am a na, ka kuoma dâwn ding i hnih?” a ta. (Judahaiin Samari mihai ieng khawm an inṭâwmpui ngai si nawh.)

en: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Pathien thilpêk le, ‘Dâwn ding mi pe rawh,’ i kuoma titu hi hre la chu nangin a kuomah i hni lem ding a nih; chun, ama chun tui hring a pêk ding che a nih,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: whence then hast thou that living water?
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pu, khaina iengkhawm i nei si nawh a, tuisunsuo ân thûk vei leh, khâwlaia inthawkin am tui hring chu i hmuh a?

en: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his sons, and his cattle?
hmr: Kan pu Jakob nêkin i ropui lem am a nih? Ama chun hi tuisunsuo hi a mi pêk a, ama khawmin a dâwn a, a nauhai le a ranhai leh,” a ta.

en: Jesus answered and said unto her, Every one that drinketh of this water shall thirst again:
hmr: Chun, Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Tûkhawm hi tui dâwn taphawt chu an dang châr nâwk a tih;

en: but whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall become in him a well of water springing up unto eternal life.
hmr: tûkhawm an kuoma ka pêk ding tui dâwn taphawt ruok chu, kum- khuoin dangchâr naw ni hai, keiin an kuoma tui ka pêk ding chu, an sûngah tuihnâr hung um a ta, chatuona hringna chenin inchik dawk a tih,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come all the way hither to draw.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pu, chu tui chu mi pe rawh, ka dangchâr nawna ding le hi chen chena tui chawi dinga ka hung nawna dingin,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “I pasal va ko la, hitakah hung nâwk rawh,” a ta.

en: The woman answered and said unto him, I have no husband. Jesus saith unto her, Thou saidst well, I have no husband:
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pasal ka nei le,” a ta, a dawn a. Isûn a kuomah, “Pasal ka nei le, i ti hi i ti dik ie;

en: for thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: this hast thou said truly.
hmr: pasal panga i nei tah, tuta mi i nei hi i pasal a ni naw hrim a nih, hi thu hi i ti dik ie,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
hmr: Nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pu, zâwlnei i nih ti ka hriet tah.

en: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.
hmr: Keini thlatuhai chun hi tlânga hin Pathien chibai an bûk hlak; nisienlakhawm, nangni chun, ‘Mihriemin Pathien chibai an bûkna hmun ding chu Jerusalemah a um,’ in ti hlak,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, shall ye worship the Father.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Nu- hmei, ka thu awi rawh, hi tlânga kher naw khawm, Jerusalema kher naw khawm, Pathien chibai in bûk hun a tlung ding a ni tah.

en: Ye worship that which ye know not: we worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.
hmr: Nangnîn in hriet naw chibai in bûk hlak, keini chun chu kan ihriet chu chibai kan bûk hlak. Sandamna Judahaia inthawkin a hung suok ding a ni sih a.

en: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth: for such doth the Father seek to be his worshippers.
hmr: Chuongchun, a hun a tlung ding a ni tah, tu khawm hin a tlung zing tah, chu pha chun Pathien chibai bûktu taktakhaiin thlarau le titaktakin Pa chibai bûk an tih, Pa chun chuong ang mi chu ama chibai bûktu dingin a zawng a nih.

en: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship in spirit and truth.
hmr: Pathien chu Thlarau a nih; ama chibai bûktuhaiin thlarau le titak- takin chibai an bûk ding a nih,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messiah cometh (he that is called Christ): when he is come, he will declare unto us all things.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Messie, Krista an ti chu a hung ding a nih ti ka hriet a, ama chu a hung phaleh iengkim mi la hril a tih,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Kei a betu che hi ama chu ka ni annâwm,” a ta.

en: And upon this came his disciples; and they marvelled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why speakest thou with her?
hmr: Chuong lai chun a închûktirhai chu an hung a, nuhmei a biek chu mak an ti hleh a; nisienlakhawm, tukhawmin, “Ieng am i zawng? Ieng- dinga nuhmei i biek am?” khawm an ti nawh.

en: So the woman left her waterpot, and went away into the city, and saith to the people,
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a tuibêl a mâksan a, khuoah a feh a, mihai kuomah,

en: Come, see a man, who told me all things that ever I did: can this be the Christ?
hmr: “Ka thilthaw taphawt mi hril peitu mi pakhat a um a, hung unla, en ta u, Krista a ni thei âwm am?” a ta.

en: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.
hmr: Chun, anni chu khuoa inthawk chun an hung suok a, a kuom tieng an pan tah a.

en: In the mean while the disciples prayed him, saying, Rabbi, eat.
hmr: Chu kâr chun inchûktirhai chun a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, fa rawh,” an lo ti an lo tih a.

en: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun an kuomah, “Bu in hriet naw fâk ding ka nei,” a ta.

en: The disciples therefore said one to another, Hath any man brought him aught to eat?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chu an inbiek a, “A fâk ding miin an hung chawipêk am a ni aw,” an in tih a.

en: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to accomplish his work.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah a hril a, “A mi tirtu dit zâwng thaw le, a sin thaw zo ding hi ka bu a nih.

en: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and then cometh the harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields, that they are white already unto harvest.
hmr: Nangnîn, ‘Bu sîkna ding thla li a la um,’ in ti a ni naw am a ni? Ngai ro, ka hril cheu hi, dâk unla, lohai en ro, tuta inthawkin sîk dingin a hmin a nih.

en: He that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal; that he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.
hmr: A sîktu chun hlaw a hmu hlak a, chatuona hringna chena um dingin ra a sîk hlak, a tutu le a sîktu an lâwm rêl theina dingin.

en: For herein is the saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.
hmr: ‘Pakhatin a tuh a, mi dangin a sîk hlak,’ ti thu hi, chutaka chun ân dik hle a nih.

en: I sent you to reap that whereon ye have not labored: others have labored, and ye are entered into their labor.
hmr: In inrimpui naw sîk dingin ka tir cheu hi; mi dangin a thawh a, nangnîn a thawsa chu in sunzawm a nih,” a ta.

en: And from that city many of the Samaritans believed on him because of the word of the woman, who testified, He told me all things that ever I did.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun, “Ka thil- thaw po a mi hril pei,” tia ân hriet- tirna thu lei khan, chu khuoa um Samari mi tamtakin Isu an ring tah a.

en: So when the Samaritans came unto him, they besought him to abide with them: and he abode there two days.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari mihai chu Isu kuomah an hung a, an kuoma um dingin an ngên an ngên a; chuongchun, chutaka chun ni hni a châm a.

en: And many more believed because of his word;
hmr: Chun, mi dang tamtakin ama thu leiin an ring ve tah a.

en: and they said to the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy speaking: for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Saviour of the world.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, nuhmei kuoma chun, “Tu zet hin chu i thu hril leia ring kan ni ta nawh; keini ngeiin a thu hril kan hriet tah a, hi mipa hi khawvêl Sandamtu a ni ngei ti kan hriet tah,” an ta.

en: And after the two days he went forth from thence into Galilee.
hmr: Chun, chu ni hni hnunga chun chutaka inthawkin a suok a, Galili ramah a fe tah a.

en: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honor in his own country.
hmr: Isu ngeiin, zâwlnei chu ama khuo tieng chun chawimawiin a um ngai nawh ti ân hriettir hlak sih a.

en: So when he came into Galilee, the Galilæans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.
hmr: Chuongchun, Galili ram a hung tlungin Galili rama mihaiin an lo lâwm a, Jerusalema ruoiṭhe laia a thilthaw po po an hmu lei khan; anni khawm chu ruoiṭhenaa chun an fe ve sih a.

en: He came therefore again unto Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
hmr: Chun, Galili rama Kana khuo, tui uoina ân changtirna kha a hung tlung nâwk a. Chun, upa tû amanih a um a, a naupa Kapernaumah a damnawh a.

en: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judæa into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.
hmr: Chun, Isu Judai rama in- thawkin Galili ramah a hung ti a hriet phingleh a hang feh a, a naupa zu sukdam dingin a ngên a, a thi vâng vâng sih a.

en: Jesus therefore said unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will in no wise believe.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Inchiknahai le thilmakhai in hmu naw chun ring tawp naw ti niu,” a ta.

en: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.
hmr: Chun, upa chun a kuomah, “Pu, ka nau thi hmain hung thla ta la,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. The man believed the word that Jesus spake unto him, and he went his way.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Fe nâwk el ta rawh, i naupa chu a dam tah ie,” a ta. Ama chun Isûn a kuoma thu a hril chu a ring a, a fe tah a.

en: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, saying, that his son lived.
hmr: Chun, a fe thlâk lai zingin a suokhaiin ama an lo tuok a, “I naupa chu a dam tah,” an lo tih a.

en: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to amend. They said therefore unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah a dam phut hun lai ân dawn a. Anni chun a kuomah, “Zâni nisa inhêm chau khan a khawsik a bo tah a nih,” an ta.

en: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.
hmr: Chuongchun, a pain Isûn a kuoma, “I naupa chu a dam tah ie,” a ti lai tak chu a nih, ti a hriet tah a; chun, ama le a sûnghaiin an rêngin an ring tah a.

en: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judæa into Galilee.
hmr: Chu chu Isu thilmak a thaw vawi hnina a nih, Judai rama inthawka Galili rama a hungin.
